intro: Holoschoenus diphyllus, commonly known as the two-leaf sedge, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and reeds. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and swampy areas, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with slender, triangular stems. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. Holoschoenus diphyllus plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
